metadata.title: CVE-2015-8732 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The dissect_zcl_pwr_prof_pwrprofstatersp function inepan/dissectors/packet-zbee-zcl-general.c in the ZigBee ZCL dissector inWireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.9 and 2.0.x before 2.0.1 does not validate theTotal Profile Number field, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (out-of-bounds read and application crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
